newsitem.title: USA: Note Bankers agrees to acquire Insurance Providers.
newsitem.headline: Note Bankers agrees to acquire Insurance Providers.

text.p: Note Bankers of America Inc on Wednesday said it signed a letter of intent to acquire Insurance Providers of America Inc and its Metro Acceptance Corp subsidiary.
The company in a statement said it would acquire the two in exchange for shares. It did not say how many shares it would exchange, and officials were not available for comment.

Insurance Providers is a non-standard auto insurance agency with about 19,000 customers and $17.7 million in annual sales, the company said. The company, which covers drivers that have been dropped by their preferred carriers, has two subsidiaries, one of them being Metro Acceptance.
Metro is an Arizona concern that finances insurance premiums, it said.
The company said the second subsidiary was IPA Financial Services. It did not say what would happen to that subsidiary once the deal was completed.
